newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RALLYING-SPANIARD SAINZ LEADS AUSTRALIAN RALLY.
newsitem.headline: RALLYING-SPANIARD SAINZ LEADS AUSTRALIAN RALLY.

text.p: Spaniard Carlos Sainz, driving a Ford, edged into the lead after Friday's first stage of the Rally of Australia, the seventh round of the World Championship.

Twice former world champion Sainz led by just one second from a pack including defending champion Colin McRae, in a Subaru, and world championship leader Tommi Makinen of Finland, driving a Mitsubishi, after the opening stage in Perth's Langley Park.
The rally continues on Saturday and heads south from Perth for 10 stages totalling 182 km. The 1,560-km race finishes on Monday.
